Sentencas: Cation deficiency in perovskite oxides can alter the crystal structure, oxygen stoichiometry and other physi-ochemical properties, substantially promote the electro-catalytic activity for oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) at elevated temperatures.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: In this work, a small strontium deficiency was introduced into SrCo0.8Nb0.1Ta0.1O3-delta (S100CNT) to promote the electrochemical activity of ORR.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Cation deficient Sr0.95Co0.8Nb0.1Ta0.1O3-delta (S095CNT) displayed higher oxygen vacancy concentration than that of stoichiometric S100CNT.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: The decreased average bonding energy (ABE) and the increased critical radius (r(c)) of S095CNT could be responsible for the decreased activation energy for oxygen ions transfer.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Consequently, the ORR activity of S095CNT cathode was significantly improved.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: The S095CNT cathode shows an area specific resistance of 0.07 Omega cm(2) at 650 degrees C, which was only about 63% of S100CNT.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Moreover, S095CNT displayed much higher CO2 tolerance than the state-ofthe-art Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta (BSCF) cathode for SOFC.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance

Sentencas: Thus, the fast ORR and high stability makes S095CNT promising material for devices involving oxygen electrochemistry such as solid oxide fuel cells, electrolysis cells, or gas separation membranes.
Titulo: Cation deficiency enabled fast oxygen reduction reaction for a novel SOFC cathode with promoted CO2 tolerance
